v.v: Job resumed speaking and he said,
â€œAs surely as God lives, who has taken away my justice,
while my life is yet in me,
My lips will not speak wickedness,
I will never admit that you three are right;
I hold fast to my righteousness and will not let it go;
Let my enemy be like a wicked man;
For what is the hope of a godless man when God cuts him off,
Will God hear his cry
Will he delight himself in the Almighty
I will teach you concerning the hand of God;
See, all of you have seen this yourselves;
This is the portion of a wicked man with God,
If his children multiply, it is for the sword;
Those who survive him will be buried by plague,
Though the wicked man heaps up silver like the dust,
he may heap up clothing, but righteous people will put it on,
He builds his house like a spider,
He lies down in bed rich, but he will not keep doing so;
Terrors overtake him like waters;
The east wind carries him away, and he leaves;
It throws itself at him and does not stop;
It claps its hands at him

v: the Almighty, who made my life bitter,
and the breath from God is in my nostrils,
this is what I will do.
neither will my tongue speak deceit;
until I die I will never deny my integrity.
my thoughts will not reproach me so long as I live.
let him who rises up against me be like an unrighteous man.
when God takes away his life?
when trouble comes upon him?
and call upon God at all times?
I will not conceal the thoughts of the Almighty.
why then have you spoken all this nonsense?
the heritage of the oppressor that he receives from the Almighty:
his offspring will never have enough food.
and their widows will make no lament for them.
and heaps up clothing like clay,
and innocent people will divide up the silver among themselves.
like a hut that a guard makes.
he opens his eyes, and everything is gone.
a storm takes him away in the night.
it sweeps him out of his place.
he tries to flee out of its hand.
and hisses him from his place.
